summary.para: Causes the audio data for a range of text to be played.

param.name: pRange
param.para: Pointer to an object that covers the text to play the audio data for. This range object is obtained by calling .

If the range has zero length, the range played is expanded to cover the entire spoken phrase. If the range has a nonzero length, the range played is expanded to include the entire word, or words, that the range partially covers.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Obtains the range of text for a word or phrase that contains audio data.

param.name: pRange
param.para: Pointer to an object that covers all or part of the text that contains audio data.

param.name: ppNewRange
param.para: Pointer to an pointer that receives a range object that covers all of the text that contains audio data. If there is no audio data for the text covered by pRange, this parameters receives NULL. In this case, the method returns S_OK, so the caller must verify that this parameter is not NULL before using the pointer.

param.name: pfPlayable
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that receives zero if none of the text covered by pRange has any audio data or nonzero otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: The current implementation of this method is simple. It clones pRange, places the clone in ppNewRange, sets pfPlayable to TRUE and returns S_OK.

summary.para: The ITfFnPlayBack interface is implemented by the Speech API (SAPI) text service. This interface is used by the TSF manager or a client (application or other text service) to control the audio data for speech input text.
Each spoken word or phrase has audio data stored with the text. This interface is used to obtain the range that covers the spoken text and to play back the audio data.
A client obtains an instance of this interface by obtaining the for the SAPI text service and calling with IID_ITfFnPlayBack.
